head.title: The Missile Shield Gap; Decades of Deterrence

hedline.hl1: The Missile Shield Gap; Decades of Deterrence

abstract.p: Paul Hirsch reply to June 6 letters warns any missile shield technology United States develops would eventually spread to even rogue nations, destabilizing world

block.p: History has shown that technological toothpaste cannot be put back in the tube. Even if the United States were able to develop a successful missile shield (letters, June 6), that technical feat would soon be within the ability of other countries, including the so-called rogue states.

History has shown that technological toothpaste cannot be put back in the tube. Even if the United States were able to develop a successful missile shield (letters, June 6), that technical feat would soon be within the ability of other countries, including the so-called rogue states.
The resulting feeling by those countries that they are invulnerable to counterattack would truly pose a greater risk to this country, even destabilize the entire world.
Deterrence has worked for more than 50 years. There is no reason to give up on it now.
PAUL HIRSCH Pacific Palisades, Calif. June 6, 2000
